item.text: Therefore what advantage does the Jew have, or what is the value of circumcision?

Actually, there are <st data-num="4183" class="">many</st> <st data-num="5158" class="">advantages</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="4413">First</st> of <st data-num="3956">all</st>,<n id="2" /> the Jews<n id="3" /> were <st data-num="4100" class="">entrusted</st> with the <st data-num="3051" class="">oracles</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>.<n id="4" />

<st data-num="5101" class="">What</st> <st data-num="5101" class="">then</st>? <st data-num="1487" class="">If</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> were <st data-num="3361 569" class="">unfaithful</st>, <st data-num="846" class="">their</st> <st data-num="570" class="">unfaithfulness</st> will not <st data-num="2673" class="">nullify</st> <st data-num="2316" class="">God’s</st> <st data-num="4102" class="">faithfulness</st>, will it?
Absolutely not! Let God be proven true, and every human being shown up as a liar, just as it is written: “so that you will be justified in your words and will prevail when you are judged.”
But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God, what shall we say? The God who inflicts wrath is not unrighteous, is he? (I am speaking in human terms.)

<st data-num="1096" class="">Absolutely</st> <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st>! For <st data-num="1893" class="">otherwise</st> <st data-num="4459" class="">how</st> could <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> <st data-num="2919" class="">judge</st> the <st data-num="2889" class="">world</st>?

<st data-num="1161">For</st> <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">by</st> <st data-num="1699" class="">my</st> <st data-num="5582" class="">lie</st> the <st data-num="225" class="">truth</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> <st data-num="4052" class="">enhances</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="1391" class="">glory</st>, <st data-num="5101" class="">why</st> am <st data-num="2504" class="">I</st> <st data-num="2089" class="">still</st> actually being <st data-num="2919" class="">judged</st> <st data-num="5613" class="">as</st> a <st data-num="268" class="">sinner</st>?
And why not say, “Let us do evil so that good may come of it”?—as some who slander us allege that we say. (Their condemnation is deserved!)
What then? Are we better off? Certainly not, for we have already charged that Jews and Greeks alike are all under sin,

just as it is written:

“There is no one righteous, not even one;,

there is no one who understands;,

there is no one who seeks God.

All have turned away;,

together they have become worthless;

there is no one who shows kindness, not even one.”

“Their throats are open graves;,

they deceive with their tongues;,

the poison of asps is under their lips.”
“Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness.”
“Their feet are swift to shed blood;,
ruin and misery are in their paths,
and the way of peace they have not known.”
“There is no fear of God before their eyes.”
Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced and the whole world may be held accountable to God.
For no one is declared righteous before him by the works of the law, for through the law comes the knowledge of sin.

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="3570" class="">now</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="5565" class="">apart</st> from the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st> the <st data-num="1343" class="">righteousness</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> (although it is <st data-num="3140" class="">attested</st> <st data-num="5259" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4396">prophets</st>)<n id="2" /> has been <st data-num="5319" class="">disclosed</st>—

<st data-num="1161" class="">namely</st>, the <st data-num="1343" class="">righteousness</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="4102" class="">faithfulness</st> of <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="5547" class="">Christ</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1519" class="">for</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st> who <st data-num="4100" class="">believe</st>. <st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> there <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3756">no</st> <st data-num="1293" class="">distinction</st>,

<st data-num="1063" class="">for</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st> have <st data-num="264" class="">sinned</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5302">fall short</st> of the <st data-num="1391" class="">glory</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>.

But they are <st data-num="1344" class="">justified</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1432" class="">freely</st> by <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="5485" class="">grace</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="629" class="">redemption</st> that is <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="5547" class="">Christ</st> <st data-num="2424">Jesus</st>.

<st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> <st data-num="4388" class="">publicly displayed</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="3739" class="">him</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">at</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="129" class="">death</st><n id="3" /> as the <st data-num="2435" class="">mercy seat</st><n id="4" /> accessible <st data-num="1223" class="">through</st> <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st>.<n id="5" /> This was <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="1732" class="">demonstrate</st><n id="6" /> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="1343" class="">righteousness</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">because</st> <st data-num="2316">God</st> <st data-num="1722">in</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="463">forbearance</st> had <st data-num="3929" class="">passed over</st> the <st data-num="265" class="">sins</st> <st data-num="4266" class="">previously committed</st>.<n id="7" />
This was also to demonstrate his righteousness in the present time, so that he would be just and the justifier of the one who lives because of Jesus’ faithfulness.
Where, then, is boasting? It is excluded! By what principle? Of works? No, but by the principle of faith!

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> we <st data-num="3049" class="">consider</st> that a <st data-num="444" class="">person</st><n id="1" /> is <st data-num="1344">declared righteous</st> by <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st> <st data-num="5565">apart from</st> the <st data-num="2041" class="">works</st> of the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="2228" class="">Or</st> is <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> the God of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="3440" class="">only</st>? Is he <st data-num="3780">not</st> the God of the <st data-num="1484" class="">Gentiles</st> <st data-num="2532">too</st>? <st data-num="3483" class="">Yes</st>, of the <st data-num="1484" class="">Gentiles</st> <st data-num="2532">too</st>!

<st data-num="1512" class="">Since</st> <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> is <st data-num="1520" class="">one</st>,<n id="1" /> he will <st data-num="1344" class="">justify</st> the <st data-num="4061" class="">circumcised</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st> <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="203" class="">uncircumcised</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">through</st> <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st>.
Do we then nullify the law through faith? Absolutely not! Instead we uphold the law.
